title: About
text:
Background
I studied Psychology and Neurosciences for my Bachelor‚Äôs (BR) and Master‚Äôs (NL). Then I did my PhD and postdoc in Germany, investigating ways to use mobile health, machine learning, and crowdsourcing to better understand tinnitus heterogeneity and improve patient care.

title: About
text:
Research Interests
I work on interventions for people dealing with chronic conditions like tinnitus, pain, depression, and anxiety. The goal is to make treatments that actually scale and meet people where they are. I mix therapeutic approaches (ACT, CBT, behavior change techniques) with digital tools like wearable sensors and smartphone tracking to see what‚Äôs happening in people‚Äôs daily lives, not just in the lab. All of this gets tested through experimental designs, systematic reviews, and meta-analyses. What I‚Äôm really after is helping people build resilience and improve their quality of life, while also figuring out the details: what works, for whom, and why.

title: About
text:
This Site
This site is built with Quarto and deployed on Netlify. The design is inspired by Simon P. Couch‚Äôs website. All blog posts are released under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

title: Projects

Active Projects

Tinnitus Repository
A Substack newsletter where I translate the latest tinnitus research into practical, evidence-based insights. Topics include:
What you‚Äôll get:

Stop falling for myths ‚Äî Learn which ‚Äúcures‚Äù are snake oil (backed by state-of-the-art peer-reviewed research)
Reduce distress today ‚Äî Simple psychological techniques you can use immediately
Stay current ‚Äî Accessible summaries of the latest scientific breakthroughs
Expert perspectives ‚Äî Exclusive interviews with leading tinnitus researchers
Your voice matters ‚Äî Participate in research surveys that shape future treatment approaches
